pullRequest.body:
Add three elementary lemmas about coefficients of series products.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

### PR summary [4fc6e8d9a4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14452/commits/4fc6e8d9a4a6a3dae89da9e3e71d82b8db23fa1c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ coeff_one_mul`
`+ coeff_one_pow`
`+ coeff_pow`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

I have removed the `awaiting-review` label according to the decision explained here
https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113486-announce/topic/Changes.20to.20the.20.23queue/near/450176907
bors d+

:v: rwst can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9926313184/job/27419748606)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9926313184/job/27419748696)
LGTM
I don't think this latex notation is sufficiently standard to warrant using here.
Removed.
Certainly this does not require that `R` be commutative.

It uses `coeff_prod` which itself requires commutativity for the `prod` `BigOperator`:
```
failed to synthesize
  CommMonoid R⟦X⟧
```
The remark was about `coeff_pow`.
Yes, my answer too. The `prod` operator requires commutativity.
You're right, I'm sorry.

You are right in principle because a product operator in general does not require commutativity. I opened a thread at https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/commutativity.20and.20BigOperators
Maybe the same one with an arbitrary constant coefficient could be useful.
Appears to be `n * a1^(n-1)`. I will work on this next.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(PowerSeries): coefficients of series products
